description.narrative: (Rwanda): ..The objective of the Huguka Dukore Akazi Kanoze (HDAK) (Get.Trained and Let's Do Fine Work) is to increase employment for youth by.providing them with work readiness and technical skills training, linking them.to the private sector, and providing training and resources to help them create.their own employment. HDAK will provide entrepreneurship.training to support youth start-ups, business development training for existing.youth micro enterprises, additional technical and vocational training for youth.pursuing further professional training, and institutional capacity building for.local organizations. These interventions will help youth find employment.opportunities along Feed the Future's targeted value chains. .. ..HDAK will provide information and training to enable youth.to make better informed health choices. HDAK builds on previous USAID successes.in youth skills development with an increased focus on engagement with the.private sector and on building the capacity of local organizations whose.mission it is to prepare youth for employment. .. ..Given Rwanda's economic and demographic dynamics--youth.comprise two thirds of the Rwandan population, high unemployment rate (18.percent), high poverty rate (38 percent), and limited job opportunities, the.provision of vocational training and business development skills is critical..The implementing partner possesses over 10 years of experience in Rwanda.successfully working with the Government of Rwanda, local organizations and the.private sector to meet the demand for youth skills development and employment.and is ideally placed to continue these efforts. .. ..HDAK's focus on preparing youth for the workplace and to.create businesses supports the Embassy's Integrated Country Strategy (ICS) Goal.2, to "Increase bilateral economic growth, trade, and investment" and objective.2.1 "Economic opportunities increased and sustained"... .... .

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults
Basic life skills for youth and adults
